intro: Solanum aculeatum, commonly known as the prickly nightshade, is a flowering plant belonging to the nightshade family (Solanaceae). It is native to South America and is characterized by its spiny stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into berries containing toxic seeds. It thrives in warm, arid environments and is often found in disturbed soils. Due to its toxic properties, it is typically avoided by both animals and humans.
